name: Lisdexamfetamine (Vyvanse)
summary: A prodrug stimulant used to treat ADHD and binge eating disorder in adults.
description: Lisdexamfetamine is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant and a prodrug of dextroamphetamine. It is approved for the treatment of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in patients aged 6 years and older and for moderate to severe binge eating disorder (BED) in adults. Its prodrug formulation provides a smoother onset and longer duration of effect compared to immediate-release stimulants, reducing the risk of misuse.

contraindications: Concurrent or recent (within 14 days) use of MAOIs

items: Binge Eating Disorder (BED, moderate to severe)

sections.text: Lisdexamfetamine is enzymatically converted to dextroamphetamine, which increases synaptic dopamine and norepinephrine by promoting their release and blocking reuptake.

adult.adhd: Start at 30 mg once daily in the morning; increase by 10–20 mg weekly as needed
adult.binge_eating_disorder: Start at 30 mg once daily; titrate by 20 mg at weekly intervals to target 50–70 mg/day

sections.pediatric: Start at 30 mg once daily; titrate by 10–20 mg weekly to maximum 70 mg/day
sections.renal_impairment: Max 50 mg/day if GFR 15–30 mL/min; max 30 mg/day if GFR <15 mL/min

items: Capsules: 10 mg, 20 mg, 30 mg, 40 mg, 50 mg, 60 mg, 70 mg
Chewable tablets: 10 mg, 20 mg, 30 mg, 40 mg, 50 mg, 60 mg

sections.text: Onset within 1–2 hours; duration of effect up to 14 hours.

serious: sudden cardiac death in patients with structural heart disease

sections.black_box: High potential for abuse and dependence. Assess risk before prescribing and monitor for signs of misuse during treatment.
other: May exacerbate symptoms of psychosis or bipolar disorder
Discontinue if significant cardiac symptoms develop

items: Blood pressure and heart rate at baseline and periodically
Signs of misuse, abuse, or dependence

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefit justifies potential risk; risk of premature delivery and low birth weight
sections.lactation: Amphetamines are excreted in breast milk; breastfeeding not recommended
sections.pediatrics: Approved for ADHD in children 6 years and older; monitor growth

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as fatigue, depression, and sleep changes.

items: Prodrug formulation reduces abuse potential via injection or insufflation
Long duration of action allows once-daily dosing
Less rebound irritability compared to short-acting stimulants
